message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new approach to enhance the performance of classifiers against adversarial attacks using a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN). It also involves training a discriminator that serves as a classifier, which is a common technique in machine learning. 

It is also likely to belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the experiments are conducted on the MNIST dataset, which is a commonly used dataset in computer vision research. 

Additionally, it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as the paper proposes a new approach to improve the robustness of classifiers, which is a common problem in AI research. 

It could also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as the paper deals with adversarial attacks, which is a common topic in security research. 

Finally, it could belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as the paper uses a GAN, which is a type of neural network, to improve the performance of classifiers.
